addon.description: Information about an addon for a Godot project.

url.description: Addon url. For remote addons, this is the git repository url. For local addons, this is a path on the local machine specifying a git repository. For symlink addons, this is the target directory that should be referenced.

source.description: Where the contents of the addon originate.

checkout.description: Git checkout reference. Can be a branch, tag, or any other specifier git supports for checking out a specific commit.

subfolder.description: Relative path to the directory of the addon's source repository or directory that should be treated as the root of this addon when installed in the project. Specifying subfolders enables compatibility with addon repositories that place the actual addon content in a nested folder. Additionally, specifying the same url across addon entries but different subfolders allows multiple addons to be referenced from the same source repository.

path.description: Path to the addons folder for your Godot project. Doesn't need to be explicitly specified unless you are doing something non-standard.

cache.description: Path to the addons cache folder for your Godot project. The cache is used to download addons and prepare them before copying them into the actual addons path.

addons.description: Map of addon name identifiers to addon entries. Because addons can share the same url, a unique name is required for each addon.
